SUMMARY: transcription factor CsiR, for Carbon starvation induced Regulator, is a finely modulate repressor that controls transcription of genes involved in degradation and transport of 4-aminobutyrate for utilization as a source of nitrogen [14731280, 12446648, 374339, 24037]. CsiR is expressed upon carbon starvation and has a repressor effect during stationary phase [14731280]. Currently, no DNA-binding sites for this regulator have been reported in literature [14731280].
